dialogue.st: Officer Hale. I presume you have a case for me then? Is that what the police report dropped on my desk is?

Yes, I had an intern drop that off earlier. I'd like for you to take a look at it as soon as possible. A burnt body was found in the outdoor pit at the ole Smith Manor this morning, completely unrecognizable.
At Smith Manor? Didn't they have a big New Year's party yesterday?

dialogue.st: Well, let's see... I talked to young Brianna for a while. Her and Elizabeth are friends, but not very close. She's such a sweet girl. I sure hope she can recover from finding the body...

Oh, and around ten, or so, I overheard an arguement between Alex and Hercules Miller. Hercules was the one who took Alex in when he moved here from New York, and he's like a brotherly figure, of sorts.

Anyways, from what I heard, Alex didn't appreciate Hercules being so overprotective of him. I don't know what he did to bring that on, but Hercules seemed pretty adament that Alex did need his protection from whatever it was.
Alex said something about "dealing with worse than a few weak blows", whatever that means. I left at that point, not wanting to evesdrop.
Nothing really happened after that. Set off fireworks at midnight. Went to bed around three in the morning.
